item.title: [Release] Sleeping Bag Method
item.dc:creator: @Dark_Anima Dark Anima
item.description:
@Dark_Anima wrote:

This whole sleeping system with the menus is weak, everything you need to bypass it is sent in a nice and clean packet.
Here’s a brief example of doing it with a sockets proxy ( or any proxy in general ) :

[Code]str = Our ByteArray converted to a String

Dim StrV() As String = str.Split("@")
For i As Int32 = 1 To StrV.Count - 1 Step 2
If Left(StrV(i).ToLower, 3) = Left(StrV(i + 1).ToLower, 3) Then
The_Answers_Index = (i - 1) / 2
Exit Sub
End If
Next[/Code]

Read full topic

item.title: [Release] Sleeping Bag Method
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:11, topic:284895”]Yong, that code isn’t great tbh, you’ve got shit loads of extra unneeded code, doing something like this would be better, but not the best approach:

							int bleh = rand(0, 10)
							switch(bleh)
							{
								case 0:
								int tehoption = 4;
								String[] options = new String[]{"@blu@Yellow", "@ora@Dark Red", "@gre@Orange", "@whi@Blue", "@cya@Cyan", "@red@Gray", "@mag@White"};
								case 1:
								int tehoption = 2;
								String[] options = new String[]{"@red@Purple", "@yel@White", "@ora@Orange", "@mag@Blue", "@cya@Green", "@gre@Rainbow", "@blu@Black"};
							}
							world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(player) {
							public void action() {
								
								owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options) {
								public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
								if(option == tehoption)
								{
									owner.setFatigue(0);
									owner.getActionSender().sendFatigue();
									owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You wake up - feeling refreshed");
								}	
								else
									owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("Wrong answer, please try again!");
								}
							});
							owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options);

						}
						
					});

So you’re only switching the required code and not the entire thing.[/quote]

Thanks for the addition

Read full topic

							int bleh = rand(0, 10)

								case 0:

								String[] options = new String[]{"@blu@Yellow", "@ora@Dark Red", "@gre@Orange", "@whi@Blue", "@cya@Cyan", "@red@Gray", "@mag@White"};
								case 1:

								String[] options = new String[]{"@red@Purple", "@yel@White", "@ora@Orange", "@mag@Blue", "@cya@Green", "@gre@Rainbow", "@blu@Black"};
							}
							world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(player) {
							public void action() {
								
								owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options) {
								public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
								if(option == tehoption)
								{
									owner.setFatigue(0);
									owner.getActionSender().sendFatigue();
									owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You wake up - feeling refreshed");
								}	
								else
									owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("Wrong answer, please try again!");
								}
							});
							owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options);

						}
						
					});

So you’re only switching the required code and not the entire thing.[/quote]

item.title: [Release] Sleeping Bag Method
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Yong, that code isn’t great tbh, you’ve got shit loads of extra unneeded code, doing something like this would be better, but not the best approach:

							int bleh = rand(0, 10)
							switch(bleh)
							{
								case 0:
								int tehoption = 4;
								String[] options = new String[]{"@blu@Yellow", "@ora@Dark Red", "@gre@Orange", "@whi@Blue", "@cya@Cyan", "@red@Gray", "@mag@White"};
								case 1:
								int tehoption = 2;
								String[] options = new String[]{"@red@Purple", "@yel@White", "@ora@Orange", "@mag@Blue", "@cya@Green", "@gre@Rainbow", "@blu@Black"};
							}
							world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(player) {
							public void action() {
								
								owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options) {
								public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
								if(option == tehoption)
								{
									owner.setFatigue(0);
									owner.getActionSender().sendFatigue();
									owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You wake up - feeling refreshed");
								}	
								else
									owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("Wrong answer, please try again!");
								}
							});
							owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options);

						}
						
					});

So you’re only switching the required code and not the entire thing.
